H0.text: what language did the ancient babylonians speak. Sumerian

H1.text: what language did the ancient babylonians speak. Eblaite

H2.text: what language did the ancient babylonians speak. Amorite

H3.text: what language did the ancient babylonians speak. Akkadian language

A4.text: Old Babylonian was the language of king Hammurabi and his code, which is one of the oldest collections of laws in the world.

A5.text: Akkadian, in its Assyrian and Babylonian varieties, was the native language of the Mesopotamian empires (Old Assyrian Empire, Babylonia, Middle Assyrian Empire) throughout the later Bronze Age, and became the lingua franca of much of the Ancient Near East by the time of the Bronze Age collapse c.â€‰1150 BC.
